level.text: Each Child Development Facility shall establish and implement a written policy regarding hand washing, which addresses the following areas:
When hand washing is required for staff and for children;
Ongoing monitoring by the Center Director or Caregiver to assure that proper hand washing procedures are followed.
Each Facility shall ensure that all staff wash their hands at the following times:
Before eating, drinking, or handling food;
Before handling clean utensils or equipment;
Before and after assisting or training a child in feeding or in toileting;
After contact with body secretions, e.g., blood, urine, stool, mucus, saliva, or drainage from wounds;
After handling soiled diapers, clothes, equipment, menstrual pads or tampons;
After caring for a sick child.
Each Facility shall provide liquid soap, and cloth towels, disposable towels, or an air hand dryer, at each hand washing area at all times.
